availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert Morrow (Knoxville, TN, asst adjt gen'l to Gen JG Foster)

body.p: Knoxville, Tennessee, soldier. Tennessee native. Son of Samuel Morrow and Melinda Morrow. Resident of Knoxville, Tennessee, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Knoxville in 1850. Resident of Knoxville in 1860. Served in the Department of the Ohio (U.S.A.) as assistant adjutant general from September 4, 1863, to November 30, 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Knox County, Knoxville, p. 105A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Knox County, Knoxville.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Knox County, District 1, p. 99.
Official Army Register for 1865 (Washington, D.C.: United States Adjutant Office, January 1, 1865), 60.
Official Army Register for 1866 (Washington, D.C.: United States Adjutant Office, August 1, 1866), 80.
Official Army Register for 1867(Washington, D.C.: United States Adjutant Office, August 1, 1867), 141.
"A Sad Suicide," The Daily Examiner (San Francisco, CA), November 28, 1873, p. 3.
"Suicide of an Army Officer," Nashville Union and American (Nashville, TN), December 5, 1873, p. 4.
"Robert Morrow (1846-1873)," Find A Grave, Memorial 5869443, accessed September 18, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/5869443/robert-morrow.
